enumeratedValue.description: NMI_b pin/interrupts reset default to enabled
When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.
When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.
Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .
Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .
Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.
Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.
A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.
Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.

Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.

Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.
The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write
The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

field.name: ERRCHN
field.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

enumeratedValue.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities . Channel priorities are not unique.
The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

field.name: VLD
field.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

register.name: TCD%s_NBYTES_MLNO
register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Disabled)

register.name: TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Enabled and Offset Disabled)

enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR
The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR
The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR
The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

register.name: TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop and Offset Enabled)

field.name: MLOFF
field.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR
The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR
The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR
The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

register.name: TCD%s_CITER_ELINKNO
register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

register.name: TCD%s_CITER_ELINKYES
register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

register.name: TCD%s_DLASTSGA
register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

field.name: DLASTSGA
field.description: Destination last address adjustment or the memory address for the next transfer control descriptor to be loaded into this channel (scatter/gather)

enumeratedValue.description: The channel is not explicitly started
The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request

field.name: INTMAJOR
field.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes

enumeratedValue.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled
The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled

field.name: INTHALF
field.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

enumeratedValue.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete
The current channel's TCD is normal format.
The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

field.name: MAJORELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each r/w
eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each r/w

register.name: TCD%s_BITER_ELINKNO

field.name: ELINK

field.name: MGSTAT0
field.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

enumeratedValue.description: Flash command or EEPROM file system operation in progress
Flash command or EEPROM file system operation has completed

field.name: EEERDY
field.description: For devices with FlexNVM: This flag indicates if the EEPROM backup data has been copied to the FlexRAM and is therefore available for read access

enumeratedValue.description: For devices with FlexNVM: FlexRAM is not available for EEPROM operation.

For devices with FlexNVM: FlexRAM is available for EEPROM operations where: reads from the FlexRAM return data previously written to the FlexRAM in EEPROM mode and writes to the FlexRAM clear EEERDY and launch an EEPROM operation to store the written data in the FlexRAM and EEPROM backup.
For devices with FlexNVM: FlexRAM is not available for traditional RAM access. For devices without FlexNVM: Programming acceleration RAM is not available.
For devices with FlexNVM: FlexRAM is available as traditional RAM only; writes to the FlexRAM do not trigger EEPROM operations. For devices without FlexNVM: Programming acceleration RAM is available.
For devices with FlexNVM: Flash memory module configured for FlexMemory that supports data flash and/or EEPROM. For devices with program flash only: Reserved
For devices with FlexNVM: Reserved. For devices with program flash only: Flash memory module configured for program flash only, without support for data flash and/or EEPROM
Physical program flash 0 is located at relative address 0x0000
If the PFLSH flag is set, physical program flash 1 is located at relative address 0x0000. If the PFLSH flag is not set, physical program flash 0 is located at relative address 0x0000
Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution.

Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state.
Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever a flash memory read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).
Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.
MCU security status is unsecure (The standard shipping condition of the flash memory module is unsecure.)
Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)

field.name: CCOBn
field.description: The FCCOB register provides a command code and relevant parameters to the memory controller

enumeratedValue.description: Program flash region is not protected
For devices with program flash only: Reserved. For devices with FlexNVM: EEPROM region is protected
For devices with program flash only: Reserved. For devices with FlexNVM: EEPROM region is not protected
Data Flash region is not protected
Triggering is disabled. If triggering is disabled, and the ENBL bit is set, the DMA Channel will simply route the specified source to the DMA channel. (Normal mode)
Triggering is enabled. If triggering is enabled, and the ENBL bit is set, the DMAMUX is in Periodic Trigger mode.
DMA channel is disabled. This mode is primarily used during configuration of the DMA Mux. The DMA has separate channel enables/disables, which should be used to disable or re-configure a DMA channel.

field.name: GO
field.description: This bit must be set before the RNGA begins loading data into the RNGA Output Register

enumeratedValue.description: RNGA Output Register is not loaded with random data.
RNGA Output Register is loaded with random data.
Notification of security violations is enabled.
Notification of security violations is masked.
RNGA is not in Sleep mode.
No security violations have occured or the High Assurance bit (HA) in the RNGA Control Register is not set.
Last read was performed while the RNGA Output Register was not empty.
Last read was performed while the RNGA Output Register was empty (underflow condition).
The RNGA Output Register has not been read while empty since last read of the RNGA Status Register.
The RNGA Output Register has been read while empty since last read of the RNGA Status Register.
The RNGA Output Register has not been read while empty.
The RNGA Output Register has been read while empty.
The RNGA is not in Sleep mode.
The RNGA is in Sleep mode.
0 system clocks between SCK edge and SIN sample
1 system clock between SCK edge and SIN sample
2 system clocks between SCK edge and SIN sample
Do not clear the RX FIFO counter.
Do not clear the TX FIFO counter.
Allows external logic to disable the module clocks.
Doze mode has no effect on the module.

field.name: DATAL
field.description: DATAL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

field.name: DATALL
field.description: CRCLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit DATA

field.name: DATALU
field.description: DATALL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: DATAH
field.description: DATAH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

field.name: DATAHL
field.description: DATAHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: DATAHU
field.description: DATAHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: GPOLYL
field.description: POLYL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

field.name: GPOLYLL
field.description: POLYLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: GPOLYLU
field.description: POLYLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: GPOLYH
field.description: POLYH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

field.name: GPOLYHL
field.description: POLYHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: GPOLYHU
field.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

field.name: WAS
field.description: Write CRC Data Register As Seed

enumeratedValue.description: Writes to the CRC data register are data values.
Writes to the CRC data register are seed values.

field.name: FXOR
field.description: Complement Read Of CRC Data Register

enumeratedValue.description: Invert or complement the read value of the CRC Data register.
Bits in bytes are transposed; bytes are not transposed.
Both bits in bytes and bytes are transposed.
Only bytes are transposed; no bits in a byte are transposed.
Bits in bytes are transposed; bytes are not transposed.
Both bits in bytes and bytes are transposed.
Only bytes are transposed; no bits in a byte are transposed.

Only bytes are transposed; no bits in a byte are transposed.
Do not start the sequence. Writes of this value have no effect.
Initiate the charger detection sequence. If the sequence is already running, writes of this value have no effect.
Do not perform a software reset.

field.name: CLOCK_UNIT
field.description: Unit of Measurement Encoding for Clock Speed

field.name: CLOCK_SPEED
field.description: Numerical Value of Clock Speed in Binary

enumeratedValue.description: Attached to a standard host. Must comply with USB 2.0 by drawing only 2.5 mA (max) until connected.

Attached to a charging port. The exact meaning depends on bit 18: 0: Attached to either a charging host or a dedicated charger. The charger type detection has not completed. 1: Attached to a charging host. The charger type detection has completed.
The module is either not enabled, or the module is enabled but the data pins have not yet been detected.
Data pin contact detection is complete.
Error in the detection sequence. See the SEQ_STAT field to determine the phase in which the error occurred.
The detection sequence has not been running for over 1 s.
It has been over 1 s since the data pin contact was detected and debounced.

field.name: TDCD_DBNC
field.description: Time Period to Debounce D+ Signal

field.name: CHECK_DM
field.description: Time Before Check of D- Line

field.name: TVDPSRC_CON
field.description: Time Period Before Enabling D+ Pullup

enumeratedValue.description: Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by twice of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by four times of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by eight times of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by 16 times of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by 32 times of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by 64 times of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
Counting uses the peripheral clock divided by 128 times of the multiplication factor selected by MULT.
The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers immediately after 1 is written to LDOK.
The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers when the PDB counter reaches the MOD register value after 1 is written to LDOK.
The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers when a trigger input event is detected after 1 is written to LDOK.
The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers when either the PDB counter reaches the MOD register value or a trigger input event is detected, after 1 is written to LDOK.

PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger is in bypassed mode. The pre-trigger asserts one peripheral clock cycle after a rising edge is detected on selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SWTRIG is written with 1.

PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger asserts when the counter reaches the channel delay register and one peripheral clock cycle after a rising edge is detected on selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SETRIG is written with 1.

field.name: BB
field.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

enumeratedValue.description: PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger back-to-back operation disabled.
PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger back-to-back operation enabled.
Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

register.name: DACINTC
register.description: DAC Interval Trigger n Control Register

enumeratedValue.description: DAC external trigger input disabled. DAC interval counter is reset and started counting when a rising edge is detected on selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SWTRIG is written with 1.
DAC external trigger input enabled. DAC interval counter is bypassed and DAC external trigger input triggers the DAC interval trigger.

Timers are stopped in Debug mode.

Clock for standard PIT timers is disabled.
Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.
Interrupt will be requested whenever TIF is set.

DMA is enabled and will assert the ADC DMA request during an ADC conversion complete event noted when any of the SC1n[COCO] flags is asserted.

Range function enabled. Both CV1 and CV2 are compared.

Configures greater than or equal to threshold, outside and inside ranges inclusive; functionality based on the values placed in CV1 and CV2.

Continuous conversions or sets of conversions if the hardware average function is enabled, that is, AVGE=1, after initiating a conversion.

register.name: CSR
register.description: Low Power Timer Control Status Register

enumeratedValue.description: LPTMR is disabled and internal logic is reset.
CNR is reset whenever TCF is set.
Pulse Counter input source is active-high, and the CNR will increment on the rising-edge.
Pulse Counter input source is active-low, and the CNR will increment on the falling-edge.
The value of CNR is not equal to CMR and increments.
The value of CNR is equal to CMR and increments.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2; glitch filter does not support this configuration.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 64; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 128; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 64 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 256; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 128 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 512; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 256 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 1024; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 512 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2048; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 1024 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4096; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2048 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8192; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4096 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16,384; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8192 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32,768; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16,384 rising clock edges.
Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 65,536; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32,768 rising clock edges.

FTM1 channel match drives FTM0 hardware trigger 0

FTM2 channel match drives FTM0 hardware trigger 1

register.name: STCTRLH
register.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register High

field.name: WDOGEN
field.description: Enables or disables the WDOG's operation

field.name: CLKSRC
field.description: Selects clock source for the WDOG timer and other internal timing operations.

enumeratedValue.description: WDOG clock sourced from alternate clock source.

field.name: IRQRSTEN
field.description: Used to enable the debug breadcrumbs feature

enumeratedValue.description: WDOG time-out initially generates an interrupt. After WCT, it generates a reset.

field.name: ALLOWUPDATE
field.description: Enables updates to watchdog write-once registers, after the reset-triggered initial configuration window (WCT) closes, through unlock sequence

enumeratedValue.description: No further updates allowed to WDOG write-once registers.
WDOG write-once registers can be unlocked for updating.

field.name: DBGEN
field.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Debug mode.

enumeratedValue.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Debug mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Debug mode.

field.name: STOPEN
field.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Stop mode.

enumeratedValue.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Stop mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Stop mode.

field.name: WAITEN
field.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Wait mode.

enumeratedValue.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Wait mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Wait mode.

field.name: TESTWDOG
field.description: Puts the watchdog in the functional test mode

field.name: TESTSEL
field.description: Effective only if TESTWDOG is set. Selects the test to be run on the watchdog timer.

enumeratedValue.description: Quick test. The timer runs in normal operation. You can load a small time-out value to do a quick test.

Byte test. Puts the timer in the byte test mode where individual bytes of the timer are enabled for operation and are compared for time-out against the corresponding byte of the programmed time-out value. Select the byte through BYTESEL[1:0] for testing.

field.name: BYTESEL
field.description: This 2-bit field selects the byte to be tested when the watchdog is in the byte test mode.

field.name: DISTESTWDOG
field.description: Allows the WDOG's functional test mode to be disabled permanently

enumeratedValue.description: WDOG functional test mode is not disabled.
WDOG functional test mode is disabled permanently until reset.

register.name: STCTRLL
register.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register Low

field.name: TOVALHIGH
field.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

field.name: TOVALLOW
field.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

field.name: WINHIGH
field.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

field.name: WINLOW
field.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

field.name: WDOGUNLOCK
field.description: Writing the unlock sequence values to this register to makes the watchdog write-once registers writable again

field.name: TIMEROUTHIGH
field.description: Shows the value of the upper 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

field.name: TIMEROUTLOW
field.description: Shows the value of the lower 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

field.name: RSTCNT
field.description: Counts the number of times the watchdog resets the system

field.name: PRESCVAL
field.description: 3-bit prescaler for the watchdog clock source

field.name: SERVICE
field.description: The EWM service mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

field.name: COMPAREL
field.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum service time is required

field.name: COMPAREH
field.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum service time is required

register.name: CGH1
register.description: CMT Carrier Generator High Data Register 1

field.name: PH
field.description: Primary Carrier High Time Data Value

register.name: CGL1
register.description: CMT Carrier Generator Low Data Register 1

field.name: PL
field.description: Primary Carrier Low Time Data Value

register.name: CGH2
register.description: CMT Carrier Generator High Data Register 2

field.name: SH
field.description: Secondary Carrier High Time Data Value

register.name: CGL2
register.description: CMT Carrier Generator Low Data Register 2

field.name: SL
field.description: Secondary Carrier Low Time Data Value

enumeratedValue.description: The IRO signal is enabled as output.

register.name: MSC
register.description: CMT Modulator Status and Control Register

enumeratedValue.description: The CMT operates in Time or Baseband mode.
The CMT operates in FSK mode.
End of modulation cycle has not occured since the flag last cleared.
End of modulator cycle has occurred.

register.name: CMD1
register.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Mark High

field.name: MB
field.description: Controls the upper mark periods of the modulator for all modes.

register.name: CMD2
register.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Mark Low

field.name: MB
field.description: Controls the lower mark periods of the modulator for all modes.

register.name: CMD3
register.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Space High

field.name: SB
field.description: Controls the upper space periods of the modulator for all modes.

register.name: CMD4
register.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Space Low

field.name: SB
field.description: Controls the lower space periods of the modulator for all modes.

enumeratedValue.description: DMA transfer request and done are disabled.
DMA transfer request and done are enabled.
Internal reference clock is disabled in Stop mode.
Internal reference clock is enabled in Stop mode if IRCLKEN is set or if MCG is in FEI, FBI, or BLPI modes before entering Stop mode.
The slow internal reference clock is selected.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 1; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 32.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 2; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 64.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 4; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 128.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 8; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 256.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 16; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 512.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 32; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 1024.
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 64; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 1280 .
If RANGE 0 = 0 or OSCSEL=1 , Divide Factor is 128; for all other RANGE 0 values, Divide Factor is 1536 .
Encoding 0 - Output of FLL or PLL is selected (depends on PLLS control bit).
Encoding 1 - Internal reference clock is selected.
Encoding 2 - External reference clock is selected.
FLL or PLL is not disabled in bypass modes.
FLL or PLL is disabled in bypass modes (lower power)
Configure crystal oscillator for low-power operation.
Configure crystal oscillator for high-gain operation.
Encoding 0 - Low frequency range selected for the crystal oscillator .
Encoding 1 - High frequency range selected for the crystal oscillator .
Interrupt request is generated on a loss of OSC0 external reference clock.
Generate a reset request on a loss of OSC0 external reference clock.

field.name: SCTRIM
field.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

field.name: SCFTRIM
field.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

field.name: FCTRIM
field.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

field.name: DMX32
field.description: DCO Maximum Frequency with 32.768 kHz Reference

enumeratedValue.description: DCO has a default range of 25%.
DCO is fine-tuned for maximum frequency with 32.768 kHz reference.
MCGPLLCLK is disabled in any of the Stop modes.
MCGPLLCLK is enabled if system is in Normal Stop mode.
External clock monitor is disabled for OSC0.
External clock monitor is enabled for OSC0.
PLL is selected (PRDIV 0 need to be programmed to the correct divider to generate a PLL reference clock in the range of 2-4 MHz prior to setting the PLLS bit).
No interrupt request is generated on loss of lock.
Generate an interrupt request on loss of lock.
Source of internal reference clock is the slow clock (32 kHz IRC).
Source of internal reference clock is the fast clock (4 MHz IRC).
Encoding 0 - Output of the FLL is selected (reset default).
Encoding 1 - Internal reference clock is selected.
Encoding 2 - External reference clock is selected.
Encoding 3 - Output of the PLL is selected.
Source of FLL reference clock is the external reference clock.
Source of FLL reference clock is the internal reference clock.
Source of PLLS clock is FLL clock.
Source of PLLS clock is PLL output clock.
PLL has not lost lock since LOLS 0 was last cleared.
PLL has lost lock since LOLS 0 was last cleared.
Loss of OSC0 has not occurred.
FLL filter and FLL frequency will reset on changes to currect clock mode.
Fll filter and FLL frequency retain their previous values during new clock mode change.

register.name: ATCVH
register.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value High Register

register.name: ATCVL
register.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value Low Register

enumeratedValue.description: Loss of RTC has not occur.
External clock monitor is disabled for RTC clock.
External clock monitor is enabled for RTC clock.

field.name: LOLRE
field.description: PLL Loss of Lock Reset Enable

enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request is generated on a PLL loss of lock indication. The PLL loss of lock interrupt enable bit must also be set to generate the interrupt request.
Generate a reset request on a PLL loss of lock indication.
Interrupt request is generated on a loss of RTC external reference clock.
Generate a reset request on a loss of RTC external reference clock
Add 16 pF capacitor to the oscillator load.
Add 8 pF capacitor to the oscillator load.
Add 4 pF capacitor to the oscillator load.
Add 2 pF capacitor to the oscillator load.
External reference clock is disabled in Stop mode.
External reference clock stays enabled in Stop mode if ERCLKEN is set before entering Stop mode.

field.name: MULT
field.description: The MULT bits define the multiplier factor mul

enumeratedValue.description: DMA transfer is enabled and the following conditions trigger the DMA request: While FACK = 0, a data byte is received, either address or data is transmitted. (ACK/NACK automatic) While FACK = 0, the first byte received matches the A1 register or is general call address. If any address matching occurs, IAAS and TCF are set. If the direction of transfer is known from master to slave, then it is not required to check the SRW. With this assumption, DMA can also be used in this case. In other cases, if the master reads data from the slave, then it is required to rewrite the C1 register operation. With this assumption, DMA cannot be used. When FACK = 1, an address or a data byte is transmitted.
Normal operation. No interrupt generated when address matching in low power mode.
Enables the wakeup function in low power mode.
An acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving byte (if FACK is set).
No acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving data byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving data byte (if FACK is set).
Acknowledge signal was received after the completion of one byte of data transmission on the bus
Slave receive, master writing to slave
Slave transmit, master reading from slave
Range mode disabled. No address match occurs for an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
Range mode enabled. Address matching occurs when a slave receives an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
The slave baud rate follows the master baud rate and clock stretching may occur
Slave baud rate is independent of the master baud rate

register.name: FLT
register.description: I2C Programmable Input Glitch Filter register

register.name: SMB
register.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

enumeratedValue.description: No SCL high and SDA low timeout occurs
SCL high and SDA low timeout occurs
No SCL high and SDA high timeout occurs
SCL high and SDA high timeout occurs
Timeout counter counts at the frequency of the bus clock / 64
Timeout counter counts at the frequency of the bus clock
I2C address register 2 matching is disabled
I2C address register 2 matching is enabled
SMBus alert response address matching is disabled
SMBus alert response address matching is enabled
An ACK or NACK is sent on the following receiving data byte
Writing 0 to TXAK after receiving a data byte generates an ACK. Writing 1 to TXAK after receiving a data byte generates a NACK.

register.name: SLTH
register.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register High

field.name: SSLT
field.description: Most significant byte of SCL low timeout value that determines the timeout period of SCL low.

register.name: SLTL
register.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

field.name: SSLT
field.description: Least significant byte of SCL low timeout value that determines the timeout period of SCL low.

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RXEDGIF disabled using polling.
Idle character bit count starts after start bit.
Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.
Normal-start + 8 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.
Use-start + 9 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.
Selects internal loop back mode. The receiver input is internally connected to transmitter output.
Single wire UART mode where the receiver input is connected to the transmit pin input signal.
UART clock continues to run in Wait mode.
UART clock freezes while CPU is in Wait mode.
Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. The receiver input is determined by RSRC.
Queue break characters to be sent.
RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests. Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU.

field.name: RIE
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.description: RDRF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
RDRF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable.

enumeratedValue.description: TDRE interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
TDRE interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

No parity error detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1, then there may be data in the receive buffer what was received with a parity error.
At least one dataword was received with a parity error since the last time this flag was cleared.
No noise detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1 then there may be data in the receiver buffer that was received with noise.
At least one dataword was received with noise detected since the last time the flag was cleared.
No overrun has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Overrun has occurred or the overrun flag has not been cleared since the last overrun occured.
Receiver input is either active now or has never become active since the IDLE flag was last cleared.
Receiver input has become idle or the flag has not been cleared since it last asserted.
The number of datawords in the receive buffer is less than the number indicated by RXWATER.
The number of datawords in the receive buffer is equal to or greater than the number indicated by RXWATER at some point in time since this flag was last cleared.
Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
The amount of data in the transmit buffer is greater than the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER].
The amount of data in the transmit buffer is less than or equal to the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER] at some point in time since the flag has been cleared.
UART receiver idle/inactive waiting for a start bit.
UART receiver active, RxD input not idle.
Break character is detected at one of the following lengths: 10 bit times if C1[M] = 0 11 bit times if C1[M] = 1 and C4[M10] = 0 12 bit times if C1[M] = 1, C4[M10] = 1, and S1[PE] = 1
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times if C1[M] = 0 or 12 bits time if C1[M] = 1.
Break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long.
Break character is 13 or 14 bits long.
S1[IDLE] is not set upon detection of an idle character.
S1[IDLE] is set upon detection of an idle character.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit8, bit7, or bit6, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE].

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.
An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an input in single wire mode.
TXD pin is an output in single wire mode.

field.name: RT
field.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

enumeratedValue.description: The parity bit is the ninth bit in the serial transmission.
The parity bit is the tenth bit in the serial transmission.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If a match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer. This field must be cleared when C7816[ISO7816E] is set/enabled.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer. This field must be cleared when C7816[ISO7816E] is set/enabled.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDFR interrupt request signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDRF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE interrupt request signal is asserted to request interrupt service.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

field.name: PARITYE
field.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error.

enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.
The dataword was received with a parity error.

field.name: NOISY
field.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise.

enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.
CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit. (FIFO) (FIFO)
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is equal to or greater than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. RTS is asserted when the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is less than RWFIFO[RXWATER].
Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)
Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.
Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).
Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
RXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.
All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.
No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
ISO-7816 functionality is turned off/not enabled.
Normal operating mode. Receiver does not seek to identify initial character.
A NACK is automatically generated if a parity error is detected or if an invalid initial character is detected.
The received data does not generate a NACK when the receipt of the data results in an overflow event.
If the receiver buffer overflows, a NACK is automatically sent on a received character.
The assertion of IS7816[RXT] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[RXT] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[TXT] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[TXT] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[GTV] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[GTV] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[INITD] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[INITD] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[BWT] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[BWT] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[CWT] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[CWT] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[WT] does not result in the generation of an interrupt.
The assertion of IS7816[WT] results in the generation of an interrupt.
The number of consecutive NACKS generated as a result of parity errors and buffer overruns is less than or equal to the value in ET7816[RXTHRESHOLD].
The number of consecutive NACKS generated as a result of parity errors and buffer overruns is greater than the value in ET7816[RXTHRESHOLD].
The number of retries and corresponding NACKS does not exceed the value in ET7816[TXTHRESHOLD].
The number of retries and corresponding NACKS exceeds the value in ET7816[TXTHRESHOLD].
A guard time (GT, CGT, or BGT) has not been violated.
A guard time (GT, CGT, or BGT) has been violated.
A valid initial character has not been received.
A valid initial character has been received.
Block wait time (BWT) has not been violated.
Block wait time (BWT) has been violated.
Character wait time (CWT) has not been violated.
Character wait time (CWT) has been violated.
Wait time (WT) has not been violated.
TXT asserts on the first NACK that is received.
TXT asserts on the second NACK that is received.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit. (FIFO) (FIFO)
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is equal to or greater than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. RTS is asserted when the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is less than RWFIFO[RXWATER].
Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)
Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.
Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).
Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
RXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.
All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.
No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RXEDGIF disabled using polling.
Idle character bit count starts after start bit.
Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.
Normal-start + 8 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.
Use-start + 9 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.
Selects internal loop back mode. The receiver input is internally connected to transmitter output.
Single wire UART mode where the receiver input is connected to the transmit pin input signal.
UART clock continues to run in Wait mode.
UART clock freezes while CPU is in Wait mode.
Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. The receiver input is determined by RSRC.
Queue break characters to be sent.
RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests. Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU.

field.name: RIE
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.description: RDRF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
RDRF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable.

enumeratedValue.description: TDRE interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
TDRE interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

No parity error detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1, then there may be data in the receive buffer what was received with a parity error.
At least one dataword was received with a parity error since the last time this flag was cleared.
No noise detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1 then there may be data in the receiver buffer that was received with noise.
At least one dataword was received with noise detected since the last time the flag was cleared.
No overrun has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Overrun has occurred or the overrun flag has not been cleared since the last overrun occured.
Receiver input is either active now or has never become active since the IDLE flag was last cleared.
Receiver input has become idle or the flag has not been cleared since it last asserted.
The number of datawords in the receive buffer is less than the number indicated by RXWATER.
The number of datawords in the receive buffer is equal to or greater than the number indicated by RXWATER at some point in time since this flag was last cleared.
Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
The amount of data in the transmit buffer is greater than the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER].
The amount of data in the transmit buffer is less than or equal to the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER] at some point in time since the flag has been cleared.
UART receiver idle/inactive waiting for a start bit.
UART receiver active, RxD input not idle.
Break character is detected at one of the following lengths: 10 bit times if C1[M] = 0 11 bit times if C1[M] = 1 and C4[M10] = 0 12 bit times if C1[M] = 1, C4[M10] = 1, and S1[PE] = 1
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times if C1[M] = 0 or 12 bits time if C1[M] = 1.
Break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long.
Break character is 13 or 14 bits long.
S1[IDLE] is not set upon detection of an idle character.
S1[IDLE] is set upon detection of an idle character.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit8, bit7, or bit6, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE].

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.
An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an input in single wire mode.
TXD pin is an output in single wire mode.

field.name: RT
field.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

enumeratedValue.description: The parity bit is the ninth bit in the serial transmission.
The parity bit is the tenth bit in the serial transmission.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If a match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer. This field must be cleared when C7816[ISO7816E] is set/enabled.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer. This field must be cleared when C7816[ISO7816E] is set/enabled.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDFR interrupt request signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDRF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE interrupt request signal is asserted to request interrupt service.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

The dataword was received with a parity error.

field.name: NOISY

enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.

peripheral.name: USB0
peripheral.description: Universal Serial Bus, OTG Capable Controller

field.name: NID
field.description: Ones complement of peripheral identification bits.

field.name: IEHOST
field.description: When this bit is set, the USB peripheral is operating in host mode.

field.name: AVBUSCHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device.

field.name: B_SESS_CHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device.

field.name: SESSVLDCHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid

field.name: LINE_STATE_CHG
field.description: This bit is set when the USB line state changes

field.name: ONEMSEC
field.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires

field.name: IDCHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed.

enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the A VBUS Valid threshold.
The VBUS voltage is above the A VBUS Valid threshold.
The VBUS voltage is above the B session end threshold.
The VBUS voltage is below the B session end threshold.
The VBUS voltage is below the B session valid threshold
The VBUS voltage is above the B session valid threshold.

field.name: LINESTATESTABLE
field.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 millisecond

enumeratedValue.description: The LINE_STAT_CHG bit is not yet stable.
The LINE_STAT_CHG bit has been debounced and is stable.

field.name: ONEMSECEN
field.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.

field.name: ID
field.description: Indicates the current state of the ID pin on the USB connector

enumeratedValue.description: Indicates a Type A cable is plugged into the USB connector.
Indicates no cable is attached or a Type B cable is plugged into the USB connector.
If USB_EN is 1 and HOST_MODE is 0 in the Control Register (CTL), then the D+ Data Line pull-up resistors are enabled. If HOST_MODE is 1 the D+ and D- Data Line pull-down resistors are engaged.
The pull-up and pull-down controls in this register are used.

field.name: DMLOW
field.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

enumeratedValue.description: D- pulldown resistor is not enabled.

field.name: DPLOW
field.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

enumeratedValue.description: D+ pulldown resistor is not enabled.

field.name: DPHIGH
field.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

enumeratedValue.description: D+ pullup resistor is not enabled

field.name: USBRST
field.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset

field.name: ERROR
field.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur

field.name: SOFTOK
field.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token

field.name: TOKDNE
field.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed

field.name: SLEEP
field.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms

field.name: RESUME
field.description: This bit is set depending upon the DP/DM signals, and can be used to signal remote wake-up signaling on the USB bus

field.name: PIDERR
field.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.

field.name: CRC5EOF
field.description: This error interrupt has two functions

field.name: CRC16
field.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.

field.name: DFN8
field.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

field.name: BTOERR
field.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

field.name: DMAERR
field.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data

field.name: BTSERR
field.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected

field.name: ODD
field.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.

enumeratedValue.description: The most recent transaction was a receive operation.
The most recent transaction was a transmit operation.

field.name: ENDP
field.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token

field.name: ODDRST
field.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

field.name: RESUME
field.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling

field.name: HOSTMODEEN
field.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode

field.name: RESET
field.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling

field.name: TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY
field.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token

field.name: SE0
field.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

field.name: JSTATE
field.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.

field.name: FRM
field.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

field.name: FRM
field.description: This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

field.name: TOKENENDPT
field.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command

field.name: TOKENPID
field.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module.

enumeratedValue.description: OUT Token. USB Module performs an OUT (TX) transaction.
IN Token. USB Module performs an In (RX) transaction.
SETUP Token. USB Module performs a SETUP (TX) transaction

field.name: CNT
field.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times.

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

field.name: EPHSHK
field.description: When set this bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint

field.name: EPSTALL
field.description: When set this bit indicates that the endpoint is called

field.name: EPTXEN
field.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers.

field.name: EPRXEN
field.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers.

field.name: EPCTLDIS
field.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

field.name: RETRYDIS
field.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

field.name: HOSTWOHUB
field.description: This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

field.name: PDE
field.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

enumeratedValue.description: Weak pulldowns are disabled on D+ and D-.
Weak pulldowns are enabled on D+ and D-.

field.name: SUSP
field.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

enumeratedValue.description: USB transceiver is not in suspend state.
USB transceiver is in suspend state.

field.name: DMPD
field.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown . enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPD
field.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown . enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPU
field.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup . enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPULLUPNONOTG
field.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in the USB OTG module, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode

enumeratedValue.description: DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is not enabled.
DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is enabled.
Interrupt was generated because of the USB asynchronous interrupt.
Synchronous interrupt has not been detected.
USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode disabled.

USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode enabled. The asynchronous resume interrupt differs from the synchronous resume interrupt in that it asynchronously detects K-state using the unfiltered state of the D+ and D- pins. This interupt should only be enabled when the Transceiver is suspended.
Returns the USB module to its reset state.

field.name: DISDEFWBUF
field.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

enumeratedValue.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute
there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception
write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending
write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending
removes the pending state from the PendSV exception
write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending
write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending
write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending
write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

enumeratedValue.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

enumeratedValue.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode
enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR
only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded
enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor
processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active
processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

field.name: USERSETMPEND
field.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

enumeratedValue.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses
trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

field.name: DIV_0_TRP
field.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

field.name: BFHFNMIGN
field.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

enumeratedValue.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up
handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

field.name: PRI_15
field.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

enumeratedValue.description: the processor attempted an instruction fetch from a location that does not permit execution
the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation
unstack for an exception return has caused one or more access violations
stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more access violations
No MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
A MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
value in MMAR is not a valid fault address
MMAR holds a valid fault address
a data bus error has occurred, and the PC value stacked for the exception return points to the instruction that caused the fault
a data bus error has occurred, but the return address in the stack frame is not related to the instruction that caused the error
unstack for an exception return has caused one or more BusFaults
stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more BusFaults
No bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation
value in BFAR is not a valid fault address
BFAR holds a valid fault address
the processor has attempted to execute an undefined instruction
the processor has attempted to execute an instruction that makes illegal use of the EPSR
the processor has attempted an illegal load of EXC_RETURN to the PC
no UsageFault caused by attempting to access a coprocessor
the processor has attempted to access a coprocessor
no unaligned access fault, or unaligned access trapping not enabled
the processor has made an unaligned memory access
no divide by zero fault, or divide by zero trapping not enabled
the processor has executed an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0
no BusFault on vector table read
No active halt request debug event
At least one current breakpoint debug event
No current debug events generated by the DWT
At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

field.name: AUXFAULT
field.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request
counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

field.name: CURRENT
field.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

field.name: TENMS
field.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

enumeratedValue.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency
The reference clock is not provided

field.name: INTID
field.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.

field.name: ASC
field.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

enumeratedValue.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is absent
A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present

field.name: AMC
field.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

enumeratedValue.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent
A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present
Fixed-priority arbitration for the crossbar masters
Round-robin arbitration for the crossbar masters
